direction.raw_text: . BATTLEFIELD - NIGHT On a FREEZE FRAME of a huge mortar on the edge of a dismal no-man's land, surrounded by trees and overhanging branches. The distant roar of battle RUMBLES ominously. SUPERIMPOSED TITLES appear and hold for a moment. Abruptly, the image springs to life. The gun FIRES deafeningly. The nearby branches shake violently. Another set of TITLES appears. The image FREEZES again as a lone bugle plays a charge. Again and again and again, the image moves, the gun DISCHARGES noisily, the image FREEZES and more sets of TITLES appear with every FIRING. On the last discharge, the trumpet fades and all hell breaks loose:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Nothing but FAST, BRUTAL FLASH CUTS of: Cannon firing in all directions. Massive explosions on the battlefield that light up the night. Troops marching across a bridge as a shell hits the river below sending water towering into the sky. An entire cavalry division galloping hard over the battlefield, blazing mortar fire visible above them on the horizon. Brief shots of the horses, their grim riders hanging on for dear life, their muscles flexing, hooves pounding the dirt. Men yelling.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : Mortar fire, explosions, smoke. A machine gunner fires. A soldier falls. Infantrymen, rifles in hand, press through the haze. More machine gunning. More soldiers go down. A massive gun fires.
direction.name: direction

result.heading: FASTER AND FASTER, MORE AND MORE CHAOTIC

direction.raw_text: of a tank tread bearing down on the CAMERA, blacking out the screen. Infantrymen trail behind the heavy machinery, firing pistols, rifles. A bridge explodes. A building explodes. The ground explodes. A bomb drops from an airplane. Aerial view of an exploding building. Anti-aircraft guns at work. Planes in the air. A machine gun fires skyward. Planes circle, filling the air. A single bi-plane. The plane's gunner, SHEP LAMBERT, looks down, surveys the situation, breaks into a grin. Shep nudges his pilot, CARY LOCKWOOD, and points. Cary looks down to see: Another plane below. In it, pilot BILL TALBOT waves and salutes. FRANCIS, the gunner, opens his mouth, smiles and nods up at them. An enemy plane arrives. The enemy pilot fires his twin machine guns. Bill and Francis' plane spins away. Bill cocks a snook at the enemy plane and waves dismissively at it, much to Francis' amusement. The planes circle in the air. The enemy plane trails Shep and Cary. Shep FIRES his machine gun to no avail as Cary watches. The enemy pilot returns fire. The two planes tango in mid-air. Shep FIRES. The enemy pilot grins and FIRES. Bullet holes riddle the side of Shep and Cary's plane. Cary warns Shep they've been hit. From the enemy plane's POV, Shep and Cary's plane streams black smoke. The two planes. Shep and Cary's plane goes into a steep dive, spinning out of control. Cary rips off his goggles as smoke pours up from below him. Flames fill the cockpit as Cary's gloved hands desperately try to keep hold of the red hot controls. The plane, streaming smoke, spins wildly downward. Shep, surrounded with smoke, looks skyward and salutes with mock gallantry. Above, Bill and Francis watch. Bill returns the salute with a smile and waves. Francis, though, doesn't look happy. Shep twists in his seat and looks around. Cary's hands grasp the controls in the flaming cockpit.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Despite the flames, Cary pulls back on the control stick. From the plane's POV: The landscape rushes by. The plane, now level, crashes into the ground and comes to an abrupt stop. Smoke. Flames. Cary jumps out of the cockpit and rushes back to Shep who is struggling to clamber out.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Cary pulls Shep out and hauls him away from the burning wreckage where the two of them collapse to the ground, half-conscious. Flames consume the plane.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: (o.s.) Level off, Cary! Level off!

direction.raw_text: for Lieutenant Shep Lambert, a patient at U.S. Army A.E.F. Base Hospital 145. Shep's temperature readings for October 11th to October 26th are indicated by a line on a graph, near a level marked CRITICAL. The distant sound of battle continues to RUMBLE.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: swings into view. This one is for Lieutenant Cary Lockwood whose readings for October 27th to November 2nd are also below the CRITICAL mark. The line continues and improves considerably by November 11th when the final reading is marked NORMAL.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The battle sounds are now joined by a loudly TICKING clock. With no sign of energy or emotion, Shep and Cary sit together on a hospital cot in full uniform. Shep wears dark eyeglasses. Cary has a coat draped over his hands. He glances off. We follow his gaze, PANNING past other patients in the hospital to a wall clock and calendar. It is November 11th and the time is almost eleven A. M. The battle's RUMBLE drones on.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: stare up at the clock. Behind his dark glasses, Shep's left eye twitches.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: slowly DISSOLVES to one last BRIEF BATTLE MONTAGE: soldiers yelling and running, guns firing noisily, a plane crashing, explosions. The final image is of a plane parked on the ground, its engine dying, its propeller slowing to a stop as we DISSOLVE BACK TO the clock face. The center of the clock is lined up exactly with the center of the propeller -- the slowing propeller blades are replaced by the clock's hands -- as if to symbolically suggest that the war has ended but time goes on. The NOISE of battle fades and only the TICKING of the clock remains. DISSOLVE TO the calendar: November 11th, 1918 -- Armistice Day. SHEP AND CARY sit motionless side-by-side on the cot. Shep has a hand over his left eye.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Shep lets go of his eye and looks at Cary as if the answer were obvious.

direction.raw_text: Shep and Cary exit the building but pause outside the doorway. They've seen something coming toward them and glance at one another before clearing out of its path. They watch glumly as a small group of wounded soldiers enter through some metal gates, walk slowly past Shep and Cary without acknowledgment, and head into the hospital. CUT TO:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The office window opens. The doctor -- no longer in white but wearing his uniform -- and his aide take a break, standing in the window frame for a little fresh air. The doctor smokes a cigarette as they discuss Shep and Cary.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The aide looks at him, quizzically.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We slowly PULL BACK from the two men.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We have pulled back far enough and now we CUT TO:
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Why can't they go on with flying? You know, the air mails or something?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I'm afraid they're unfit for further service in that direction.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: They fell, you know -- six thousand meters. (shakes his head, sadly) Like dropping a fine Swiss watch on the pavement. Shattered both of them. Their nervous systems are deranged, disorganized, brittle.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Spent bullets.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Spent bullets. That's it. (nods) They're like projectiles, shaped for war and hurled at the enemy. (gestures with cigarette) They've described a beautiful, high-arching trajectory. And now they've fallen back to earth. Spent. Cooled off. Useless.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Oh, well, if they take care of themselves, they'll pull through all right.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Even if they do take care of themselves, what good are they? What can you expect of them? (shakes his head) I hate to think what may become of them.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: Two uniformed men with familiar faces -- exuberant pilot Bill and reserved gunner Francis -- arrive at the bottom of the stairs in front of the hospital. Bill, with his arm in a sling, and Francis, using a cane, start up the stairs and wave.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: At the top of the stairs, Shep and Cary wave back, pleased to see them. CARY Hello, Bill! Hiya, Francis!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Unexpectedly, Shep and Cary hurry down the stairs past them.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Bill and Francis watch, surprised, as Shep and Cary hurry off.

direction.raw_text: Shep and Cary, already seated in the back of a waiting automobile, grin like kids.

direction.raw_text: From the stairs, Francis smokes a cigarette and looks down at Shep and Cary uncertainly. But Bill takes the news in stride -- he smiles and waves his hat at them.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Smiling, Shep and Cary wave back as their car drives off.

direction.raw_text: Strolling down the sidewalk four abreast, as if they own the town, come our heroes -- Bill, Shep, Francis and Cary -- in smart hats and dinner clothes. Outwardly, they seem to have recovered from their wounds. But: Shep still wears his dark glasses and we occasionally glimpse his eye twitching. Cary's bandages are gone but he has not regained full use of his hands. His personality is dark and dry, more subdued than Shep's, and he comes across as the most levelheaded, rational member of the group -- its unacknowledged leader. Francis seems to have suffered the greatest toll psychologically. A narcoleptic, strangely detached and unemotional much of the time, always on the verge of dozing off, his speech slurs even when he isn't drunk. Only the athlete of the group, Bill -- a burly Texan whose full name is William Talbot -- is in outstanding physical shape. But he is reckless, restless, and temperamental, covering up unnamed insecurities with bravado and forced exuberance.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: As a group, they turn and head into a nearby building.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: How 'bout a cocktail?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Not a bad idea at that.

direction.raw_text: made of light bulbs, outside the building. It spells out CLARIDGE'S -- a popular Parisian drinking establishment for Anglo-Americans.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Numerous shelves holding numerous bottles of liquor. Employees in white jackets hurriedly rush in and pull down a few bottles.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The place is packed with well-dressed men and women. The bar is crowded with men (and men only, for no women are allowed to sit at Claridge's bar) smoking, drinking, conversing. At the end of the PAN, we discover our heroes entering, greeted by an employee who takes their hats.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: - NEAR THE BAR An attractive young woman with a wide, vacant stare stands against a wall opposite the bar holding a champagne glass in her hands. Her name is NIKKI and she seems to be in a world all to herself. Our four handsome heroes file past her, intent on finding a table. Only Cary pays any attention to Nikki. After they have all passed her, he pauses to turn and stare. She's extremely nearsighted and doesn't notice him. He looks at the glass in her hand, puzzled. He starts off but then pauses. After a second uncertain look, he moves off to join his friends who stand together and peer around the crowded room, unable to find a place to sit. Cary keeps looking at Nikki. He glances at the others and they follow his gaze:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: still wearing a blank expression, clutches the glass in two hands.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: in her hands. Between her fingers, we glimpse its contents -- a complete set of men's false teeth. We PULL BACK to discover that Cary has approached her. He's standing right next to her and is staring at the glass. She finally notices him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: After another look, Cary turns to his friends.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Shep, Bill and Francis hurry over like children and crowd around to stare in amazement at the teeth. Nikki is unimpressed by all the attention.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: As quickly as they arrived, Shep, Bill and Francis depart. Cary starts after them but stops to politely address Nikki who has gone back into her trance.

dialogue.raw_text: Go back to flying. Fly the air mails. BILL Aw, we couldn't fly a kite. FRANCIS Maybe a small kite.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Well, there must be something you can do.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: We've got to tend to our drinking. We don't get much opportunity. FRINK Lots of things going on outside. Sun shining, trees growing, people walking around.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Say! Is that STILL going on?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (laughs) Sounds pretty pre-war to me.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Hey. Don't I rate an introduction? Who's your swell friend?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Oh, her? Just an old hussy we found scattered around.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (off Frink) Pay no attention. Sometimes he goes away.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: who sits at his table, staring into space, holding his unread menu in his lap.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: is pleased to see Cary.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: She rises to join him.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Oh! He didn't go.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: startled, rises and stares at Nikki as she approaches.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: She tries to take his hands but he pulls them away in horror and stuffs them in his pockets.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Wildly uncomfortable, Cary glances around like a cornered animal and finally stalks away without a word, hands still stuffed in his pockets. Stunned, Nikki watches him exit the building. She realizes she's done something terribly wrong and moves to follow him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: But Shep intercepts her. Upset, she whimpers. SHEP (more in disbelief than anger) If you aren't the WORST! First, you insult his hands and make him mad. Then you cry over them and make him self-conscious. Come on back here. Come on. He clasps her hand and leads her to:
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Oh, I'm so sorry. Your hands...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Oh, your poor hands! Your poor, poor hands.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Oh!
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: Francis and Bill watch, disturbed, as Shep guides a crying Nikki onto a stool beside them. Shep sits next to her as she continues to sob. She pulls out a compact to fix her tear-stained face.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Nikki takes a sip, then busies herself with putting away her compact. Meanwhile, Bill leans in.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Well, that's torn it. He'll never come back now.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Then we'll have to find him.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: What for?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: To explain how sorry I am.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (amused at her distress) We-ell. You don't have to get so emotional about it.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Who's getting emotional?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: You are. You're coming all apart. (hands her a glass) Here. Take a drink of this. Make you laugh and play.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (to Shep) Say, what's she crying about?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: She's crying on account of they didn't wash her strawberries this morning.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (to Nikki) Didn't they wash your strawberries this morning? Well, there ain't a whole hell of a lot that we can do about that now.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (agrees, sadly) No.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: Frink watches suspiciously as Shep pays the tab, rises and whispers to Nikki.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Nikki obediently hops off her stool and Shep leads her away from the bar, toward the exit. Bill and Frink are distressed to see her go. Bill calls after Shep:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Bill gestures grandly toward the bar with its many shelves of liquor bottles.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Francis and Bill head out the door. After a moment, Frink follows behind.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Let's go.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Hey! Where're you goin'?!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Oh, out.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (rises) Out where?!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (o.s.) Out to get a drink.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Don't you suppose you could arrange that here?!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Nope. We gotta go somewheres else.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (without missing a beat) Okay. Come on, Francis. We got to go somewheres else to get a drink.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: A taxi cab -- filled with Bill, Francis, Shep, Nikki and Frink -- pulls up to a restaurant. As it stops, Bill rises and points to someone at a sidewalk table.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The others look.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The group cheers, spills out of the taxi and heads for:
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Hey! There he is!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Where?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Come on!
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: where Cary sits reading a newspaper. SHEP (o.s.) Cary! Cary looks up. He rises, a little startled, and politely removes his hat. The others crowd around him.
direction.name: direction

direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: A waiter joins them as they settle in.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The waiter departs. Off her order, Bill gives Nikki a look.
direction.name: direction

Bill removes the toothpicked olive and swallows his Martini whole. He watches Nikki rubbing her champagne's drinking straw between her hands as if she were a Boy Scout trying to start a fire.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Meanwhile, Cary attempts -- with some success -- to drink his Martini with one unsteady hand. Bill inspects Nikki's mouth.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The men are amused. Nikki sips her champagne.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Bill chuckles. Shep abruptly rises and walks off, presumably to the rest room.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Bill and Nikki laugh at this. Suddenly, Nikki grows thoughtful. NIKKI All the same, he'd look funny the other way -- even in a painting. They all consider this for a moment as a fresh round of drinks arrives. Frink abruptly rises and walks off, presumably to the rest room.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: An odd CHIMING sound distracts them. They look off to see:
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Say, what are you tryin' to do, disown us?

dialogue.raw_text: (genuinely polite) Hello. Won't you sit down?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Sure we'll sit down. What'd ya think we'd do? Stand around?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (with a wave, to Frink) Thank you.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Hello, Cary.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Hello, Shep. Hello, Nikki. What will you have to drink? FRANCIS Martini!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Martini!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Martini!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Martini!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Quatre Martinis?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Uh, could I have champagne, please?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Champagne? Oui.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Boys, she's goin' to be a problem.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (explains, to Bill) That's what I started on. (to Cary) It upsets me if I change over to anything else.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (to Bill) There's a lot of things wrong with this one. (to Nikki) What were you doing at the bar at Claridge's anyway? SHEP Yes. Don't you know you're not supposed to be there?

dialogue.raw_text: There's a sign on the wall says ladies must sit at the back.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Can't read signs.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Well, we'll just have to take care of her, that's all.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Do you think she's good-lookin' enough?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Oh, I know I'm not very good- looking but--
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: But what?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: But when I was a little girl, my mother always said I had the nicest hair-ribbon.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Then there's her drinking.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: What's the matter with my drinking?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: You're a sissy drinker.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Well, maybe I can improve.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Then there's her teeth. Why, one of 'em is turned sideways.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (points) You mean this one?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: That's it.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Why don't you have it turned around?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I don't have it turned around on account of it's a kind of help.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Well, in what respect does it kind of help?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Well, you see, when anyone kisses me too hard, it splits my lip. And you could tell when anyone kissed me too hard on account of my lip would bleed. So now I don't let anyone kiss me -- hard.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Well, we'll let that pass.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Where's he gone?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Shep went off to sharpen his skates.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Now, about your nose.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: What about my nose?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: It isn't straight. It kind of turns up at the end.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Well, when I was a little girl, I got bumped by a swing.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: How'd you happen to get bumped?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I just walked through the gate. I was only seven.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Oh, poor dear. Didn't you see it?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I can't see very far.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Did it hurt?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: It made me dizzy all day.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Well, I guess we can't hold that against her.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: We all make mistakes.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: That's right. Michelangelo painted Adam with a navel.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Where's he gone?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: He went off to shave a horse.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Have you got a husband or anything?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: No husband. CARY A mother?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Mother, yes. But we haven't met in quite a long time.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Why not in a long time?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Well, on account of my mother's name was Beulah. Now, you can't have a mother named Beulah. So I changed it to Jane. And that's how it all began.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: the narcoleptic, arms folded, asleep in his chair. He awakes with a frown, pulls a pocket watch from inside his jacket, opens it, and looks at it. The chiming ends and he rises without a word and exits. AT THE TABLE Nikki watches Francis' exit curiously. Bill waves her off before she can ask:

direction.raw_text: Cary puts a fist on his hip and gives Nikki an exasperated look. Taxi horns squeak. Francis, Shep and Frink return from their various adventures and sit down as Bill gives Nikki his opinion of Francis.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Bill grins as Nikki inspects him closely through her lorgnette.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Bill's face falls. He looks at Nikki.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: She nods. Shep is amused.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Shep looks down the street.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: They all look to see:

dialogue.raw_text: He's goin' off to tame an alligator.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Who is he, anyway?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Francis used to fly with us in the 94th. The best shot in the squadron. Brought down twelve planes. Used to call him "Sudden Death." He lost interest after his teammate got killed. He's lonesome is all.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I like him.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: He carries a chiming watch on account of he's always falling asleep in the daytime.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: What kind of chimes?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Oh, Westminster, Canterbury, and Whittington.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I'll take vanilla.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I think he's a washout.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Well, just because you're a big bombardier and an All-American--
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (interrupts) All-American what?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Halfback.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Where?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Oh, Montana State or somewhere. Idaho or Nebraska or the Carlisle Indians or something. Didn't you never read about Bill? Bronko Bill -- the Alabama Flash?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (skeptical) I think it's a forgery.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Say! What do you want me to do? Tackle a horse?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Sure. Go ahead. Tackle a horse.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: rolling down the street in their direction.

dialogue.raw_text: Look out, horse!
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: rolling along as Bill runs in and tackles the horse, locking his big arms around the animal's front legs to trip up the poor creature.

direction.raw_text: Cary, horrified, stands and yells:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Cary runs off, toward Bill, leaving a thrilled Shep and a worried Francis with a distressed Nikki. They all stare in concerned amazement as a crowd of pedestrians stops to watch the excitement.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Hey, Bill! Bill! Come back here!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (distraught) Oh, Bill!
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: Cary rushes up to the startled cab driver who is pulling hard on the reins.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Cary forces a wad of francs into the driver's hand. The cabman protests in French but takes the cash.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Hey! What's the idea -- runnin' down my friend like that? Here!
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: R VIEW of the fallen horse as the driver descends from the cab. Standing up now, Bill tries to haul the horse to its feet while Cary tries to placate the driver.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Never mind. Look where you're going in the future now. You just watch out where you're going!
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: Bill grabs the horse by its bridle and tries to pull it up. The horse, sorely annoyed, gets up on its own and shakes its head violently to drive Bill away. Bill hangs on and tries to calm the horse. Cary tries to pull Bill away as Frink, Francis and the driver gather around. Bill is more interested in petting the horse which understandably shies away from him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Satisfied with the outcome of all this, Bill heads back for the sidewalk.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The driver nods but is more concerned with reining in his skittish horse.

direction.raw_text: The cabbie salutes Cary but pays more attention to his horse.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: (admonishes Bill) Now listen, come on out here, you old fool. (to the shying horse) Whoa, whoa. BILL Nice horsie.

dialogue.raw_text: (to Bill) Now, listen, you ought to be ashamed of yourself. You old fool! You know what you'll do? You'll kill yourself one of these days. Now, come on, get out of here. Now, listen--

dialogue.raw_text: (to the driver) You all right now, brother?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: All right. Now, you just keep your horse, see? You got your money.

dialogue.raw_text: (pleased with himself) Ahhh. Wasn't that a great spill?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Hey! Where are you going?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Would you all excuse me for a moment?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Well, where are you going?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (a grave announcement) To take a Chinese singing lesson.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Hooray!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Hooray! Hooray! Hooray! Hooray!

direction.raw_text: walks proudly into the restaurant as the men cheer. A smiling maitre d' directs her to the ladies' room.

direction.raw_text: Frink watches Nikki disappear from view and, after a glance at the others, rises and follows her. Shep, Bill and Cary remain at the table, laughing and drinking. Bill turns to Cary with a smile.

direction.raw_text: Bill thinks about this and nods.

dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I think she's the kind that sits down on phonograph records.

direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Nikki pushes his arm away and heads for the table. Frink watches her go, a dark look on his face.

dialogue.raw_text: Say, Nikki, let's ditch these drunks and go off somewhere by ourselves. These crazy fools are liable to do anything.

dialogue.raw_text: (hopeful) Do you think so?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Since the war, they don't care what happens.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: And do you?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I'll say so. I've got more important things to think of.

dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Well, my work.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: What kind of work?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (genuinely) How nice for you!
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: Cary gives her a look. Bill clears his throat.

direction.raw_text: Whatever that means. The men rise and retrieve their hats.

dialogue.raw_text: Nikki? Are you the kind of girl that sits down on phonograph records?

dialogue.raw_text: (to Francis) What did I tell you?

dialogue.raw_text: (abruptly brightens) Take me dancing?

dialogue.raw_text: What place you wanna go?

dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I'll take vanilla.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Somebody pay for the drinks!

direction.raw_text: A festive Parisian night spot. Dance MUSIC plays while a floor show, lit by moving spotlights, unfurls in the huge, darkened ballroom which is ringed with crowded tables. A handsome male dancer, in tuxedo and top hat, whirls exuberantly around the floor, surrounded by beautiful chorus girls. Somewhere above all this, Nikki, lit by spotlight flashes, sits on the edge of a ringside balcony observing the show with eager interest through her lorgnette. The show continues: after a few twirls, the dancer links arms with the girls to form a line and do some precision high-kicking. The music continues but the dance apparently ends and the lights come up. Impressed, Nikki is breathless. NIKKI My, my! Isn't this nice?! Nearby, the men sit at a roped-off table for six on a low balcony. Cary and Francis sit glumly on one side of the table as Bill tries to tell a story to the others (Frink; a nameless young woman nicknamed "Kiss-Me-Quick" who appears in this scene only; Shep and Nikki). BILL Now, listen, men. I'll tell ya something funny. Cary and Francis look doubtful about this. Bill sits at the table. BILL I was only four years old once.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Nobody laughs or even changes expression. CARY (pointedly, after an awkward pause) I wonder what's doing in Portugal tonight. Bill is disappointed at the response.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Cary gives her a look, then rises and peers with one eye into the open bottle of champagne on the table between him and Nikki. He gestures at the bottle as he sits back down.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Everybody cracks up -- except Nikki, who looks a little hurt. An empty champagne bottle is placed on the floor.

dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Amazing.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: And my aunt had a very low-neck dress on.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Said his aunt had on a very low-neck dress.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Can't believe it.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: And she sat right across the table in front of me. And I said, "Auntie -- I can see your knees!"

dialogue.raw_text: Maybe I'd better do my match trick.

direction.raw_text: strays to Nikki's legs and up her dress.

dialogue.raw_text: You'll have to watch that lad, Nikki. He's a member of the Wandering Hands Society and he has a groping good time.

dialogue.raw_text: Your behavior, sir, is unseemly, unethical, indelicate and lousy. Have I made myself clear?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: All right. My mistake. I'm sorry.

direction.raw_text: The group enters the spacious, empty lobby, laughing loudly. Someone says, "Wheeee!" Others say, "Ssshhh!" They cross to the front desk.

direction.raw_text: The clerk is fast asleep, his head down on the desk. Nikki is about to wake him when Bill bounds forward.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Bill waves the others on and they exit toward the elevators. Once they've gone, Bill, the athlete, vaults the front desk and lands -- with a little noise -- on the other side, without waking the clerk. He cautiously checks the clerk to make sure the sleeping man hasn't awakened, then fetches Nikki's key from its cubbyhole. Bill leaps up on top of the desk, landing on his rear end, swinging his legs around -- nearly kicking the clerk in the process -- then silently slides off the desk to the floor. Watching the sleeping clerk warily, Bill tiptoes away. At the last possible moment, Bill purposefully WHACKS the signal bell with his hand, making it RING noisily. The clerk awakens with a start and grabs a nearby telephone just as Bill disappears from view.

direction.raw_text: Cary stares out the window at a rainy day. SHEP Look at those legs, Cary. My, they nearly match. Cary turns from the window. SHEP Did you ever see such a swell set of legs?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Cary manages a slight grin. As he does, there's a knock at the door. Everyone hollers, "Entrez!" Shep runs to the door and opens it.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The others cheer happily. Two hotel employees enter carrying trays loaded with already poured drinks. Shep hands a glass to Nikki.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Shep hands Bill a glass. Francis sits groggily on the sofa, a drink in each hand. He polishes off one and then the other. He leans over and sets one empty glass on the floor but holds on to the other as he puts his head to the nearby pillow and dozes off. Cary, Bill and Shep crowd around Nikki who is still seated -- all have drinks. The tray-carrying hotel employees have apparently exited. Bill proposes a toast.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: They drink. Another knock at the door. They all yell, "Entrez!" The door opens to reveal Frink -- whose face falls when he sees the other men with Nikki. The others are not happy to see him, either.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Cary hands his glass to Bill and moves to meet Frink as he enters.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Cary watches Frink approach Nikki.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: After a pause, Nikki looks up at him uncertainly as if she doesn't recognize him. Then she peers at him through her lorgnette.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Frink moves off to find a chair. Shep sets down his drink and follows him. Frink starts to move a chair but Shep stops him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: During the above dialogue, Bill nudges Cary mischievously and they glance down at the tray in front of them. They exchange knowing nods, pick up some drinks, bring them over, and offer one to Frink.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Bill and Shep watch with interest as Frink holds out his hands, palms up.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Frink turns them over, palms down. Cary looks at Frink's steady hands, impressed.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Cary looks down at the drink in his own hand.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Cary sets the glass on top of Frink's downturned hand. Frink balances the full glass with ease.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Cary places a second full glass on Frink's other hand. Frink balances both glasses with ease. Cary expresses keen admiration.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Frink looks at the others, a little smugly. Cary slowly backs away and walks off, as do the others. Frink's face falls as he realizes he has been left standing in the middle of the room with two drinks balanced on top of his hands and no way to safely remove them. Cary, Shep and Bill return to Nikki and crowd around her.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Frink, abandoned, reluctantly pleads with the others.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: But the others simply ignore him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The Asian maid who has been working on Nikki's feet abruptly rises.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The men cheer, "Yay!" and Nikki smiles at the woman as she exits with her tools. The men crowd closer to peer down at Nikki's legs.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: But Nikki quickly covers her toes with a hand.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Nikki wraps her robe around her legs and stuffs them under body. Since she's no longer using her footstool, Cary commandeers it and sits on it.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Nikki grows extremely somber and begins to tell a story -- very slowly. Her eyes stare into space and her voice conveys terrible sadness.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: A worried look crosses Cary's face.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Shep and Bill listen soberly.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Their eyes pop. The men jump up eagerly and run off. Nikki, thoroughly nonplussed by this, takes a sip of her drink. Shep, Cary and Bill crowd around a tray and start imbibing. Meanwhile, Frink looks around unsuccessfully for a way to lose the two glasses that are still balanced on his hands. For the first time in this scene, Nikki is on her feet. She walks over to the drink tray and puts a friendly hand on the shoulders of Shep and Cary.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Nikki walks off, exiting into her bedroom. The men continue to stand around the tray, drinking. In the background, Francis sleeps on the sofa. Over by the fireplace, a frustrated Frink, still balancing the two drinks, casts a dirty look at the others. He angrily hurls the glasses into the fireplace, smashing them loudly. Francis, startled awake by the noise, jumps off the sofa. The others stare at him. SHEP My, my. What's HE getting so excited about? Frink, furious, rubs his hands with a handkerchief and stuffs it in his pocket. FRINK You guys think you're so darn smart. Shep, Bill and Cary laugh at this. Cary consults his pocket watch.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Bill waves goodbye. Cary eats a last olive, tosses the toothpick and heads for the front door.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Cary exits as Nikki's voice drifts in from:
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Hi, Nik!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Hello, Nikki!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (in mid-yawn) Hello.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Good morning, Nikki.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (o.s.) Hello, Bill. Hello, Shep. Hello, Cary. Hello, Francis.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (from the sofa) Morning, Nikki.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I didn't expect to see you all so early.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: We camped on your doorsteps last night. And this morning we all moved in.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Despite your practically innumerable faults, we adore you. We've decided to adopt you.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Well, for heaven's sakes! Look at Nikki! What are you having done to yourself, gal?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Whatcha having your toes painted for, Nikki?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I don't know. (looks at Bill and Shep) Seemed like a good idea at the time.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Why, look at Nikki's legs, would you? That there is practically the loveliest pair of legs I ever saw in all my born days.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Like my legs?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Well, what do you want me to do about it? Burst into tears?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Would it embarrass you, Nikki, if Cary were to burst into tears?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (looks at her legs) On account of my legs? Oh! (turns to Cary, heartfelt) I think that would be sweet.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Oh, boy! Here come the drinks!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Here, Nikki, drink this. CARY Make you laugh and play.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: That's what I want to do, laugh and play.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Here's to Nikki's dainty legs. As smooth and hairless as an egg.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Wheee!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Hurray!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: 'Ray!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Well! Here comes that licentious old man. Who invited him?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (sneering) Still drinking?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (shakes his head mockingly) How can you tell?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Morning, Nikki.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Oh, it's you. (after a pause, reluctantly polite) Won't you sit down?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Thank you.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Say, I don't think Nikki likes you.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Oh, no?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: No. What do you wanna hang around for?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Well, what do YOU hang around for?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Me? Why, I came to bring Nikki some posies. I'll bet you didn't bring Nikki any posies.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Well--
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Have a drink?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: No, thanks.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Cure the shakes.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I haven't got the shakes.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Let's see. Hold out your hands.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: No, turn them over.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Say, that's pretty good.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Let's see if you can hold this.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Say, that's great.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Steady as a rock!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Well, I guess that'll keep his hands out of mischief for a while.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Hey. Take these off.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Now, let's see. Where were we before we were so rudely interrupted?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: We were talkin' about Nikki's legs.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: That's right. We were talkin' about Nikki's legs. And havin' a fine time, too.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Finis.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Let's inspect the job.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Oh, my poor toes. Don't look too close.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Well, what's the matter with your toes?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Well... when I was a little girl...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: ... my mother bought me a new pair of shoes. ... And they were WAY too short. ...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: ... And I had to walk all the way to Sunday school and back. ... Down the road. ... And it was hot and dusty.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (hand to his face) Oh, take her away! She's breakin' my heart! (sobs)
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: And when I got home ...  my toes were spoiled.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (on the verge of tears) Oh, dear, oh, dear. SHEP That's such a sad story. Let's all have a drink, quick!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: And now would you all excuse me? On account of I'm gonna put on a dress.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Well, why not?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Well, cheerio, fellas. I'm off.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: See ya later.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: (o.s.) What are the plans for the day? Shep, drink in hand, enters and leans on the wall outside the door.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Nikki appears in the doorway, dressed to go out.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Lost in thought, Nikki moves off and a worried Shep follows her to:
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Well, on account of it's raining and everything, we thought we'd go over to the Cluny and play billiards and drink beer.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (o.s.) How about Cary?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Went to get his hat and coat. He's going to Pere Lachaise.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (o.s.) Pere Lachaise? What's Pere Lachaise?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: A cemetery. How 'bout you coming with us?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (o.s.) No. I'm going with Cary.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (concerned) You've been invited?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Do you think Cary might object?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Well, I have an idea he'd like to be alone.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Why alone?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Well, Cary likes to be alone. He's as brittle as a breadstick. One silly crack from you and he might break up in sections.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (thinks about this) Well, then, I don't think he should be left alone. (beat) Tell me, what's Cary doing in Paris?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: What are we all doing in Paris?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I know. But why doesn't he go home?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Well, he's not ready to go home. What could he do if he went home? Have people cry over his hands?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Well, it seems - a pity to go on like this. He's such a sweet soul.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: One of the best.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Isn't he just sort of wasting himself?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: On the contrary. He's trying awfully hard to get hold of himself.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: Shep stops Nikki from leaving. She's a little downcast as he admonishes her:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Nikki opens the front door and exits into:
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Now, listen. If you tag along, for heaven's sake, be careful what you say. Don't start getting sorry for him and don't cry over him. (with a chuckle) And, above all, don't make any unfortunate remarks, hear?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (earnest) Oh, I won't. Why, who ever heard of such a thing?
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: where Cary -- carrying coat, hat and cane -- emerges from a suite across the hall from Nikki's and heads for the elevator. He stops when he hears Nikki calling to him. She runs to join him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Without waiting for a reply, she starts for the elevator, then stops to look down at her shoes.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: She leaves him and runs back to:
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Cary?! Cary? I'm coming with you.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Oooh! (to Cary) Ooh, wait for Nikki!
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: of her suite where Shep still stands. He watches with surprise as Nikki runs in.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Puzzled, Shep follows Nikki who rushes to:
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: (calls back to Cary) Wait for Nikki!
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: T Nikki draws the curtain to reveal her enormous collection of dresses and shoes. Shep, drink in hand, wanders in slowly and leans against the doorjamb as he watches Nikki pull off one pair of shoes and put on a seemingly identical pair of red ones.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Shep watches her hop and scurry off.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . AVENUE CASIMIR-PERIER - LATER THAT DAY Passerbys carry umbrellas on this rainy day. A taxi cab pulls up to a sidewalk cafe -- LA REGENCE, according to the awning that covers the little iron tables. Cary emerges from the cab and pays off the driver as Nikki hurries under the awning. Cary joins her and, after a word to the driver ("Restez ici."), looks at the rain.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: They move toward the cafe. As Cary hangs up his hat, a waiter arrives.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Cary orders the drinks as Nikki moves to sit at a table.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The waiter acknowledges this and heads inside, calling out the order to his bartender. Cary joins Nikki at the table and sits down. She removes her gloves and fixes her face while he takes out a cigarette and lights it under the following:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The waiter arrives with the drinks. As he spritzes seltzer water into their glasses, Cary leans over to light a cigarette for Nikki. The waiter leaves and they drink.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Nikki exhales, drinks, looks at Cary and shakes her head.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Nikki finishes the last of her drink.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Cary leaves some money, Nikki gathers her things. They rise and walk off.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: What are you changing your shoes for?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: On account of I can walk faster in red shoes.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (to Nikki) Perhaps we'd better stay here a while till it clears up.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Could we sit down here, do you suppose?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I think so. Would you like something to drink?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: What should I drink now, do you suppose?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (to the waiter) Deux picon citrons.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Picon citrons?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Very refreshing. Make you laugh and play.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (amused) That's what you always promise. (suddenly serious) Cary, why does Shep Lambert go on drinking so desperately?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Don't we all?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Not like Shep.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Well, Shep has that tic under his eye, you know. Takes a lot of drinks to keep that quiet.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: But isn't there some kind of treatment or something?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Shep could never stand a long course of treatment. Drinking's the only corrective so far as he's concerned. He's found out the tic doesn't work when he's tight. So he stays tight.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Seems such a pity. How did he get the tic?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: In the war.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I know. But how?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Well, it's not very romantic.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Well, don't tell me if you don't want to.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Well, you see, a tic is a nervous habit.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Yes?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Lice under his bandages.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Oh.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: He had the devil of a time. He nearly lost his mind. So you'll have to excuse him a little. NIKKI I'm so sorry for Shep.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Well, don't let him know it.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Well, isn't he going home? Not ever?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Not ever. Not in his dark glasses anyway.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Can't something be done for him?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: He'll have to be - reborn.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: How's he going to end?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Well, how are you going to end? How am I going to end? How is ANYONE going to end? How's your picon citron go?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: It goes fine. But doesn't ANYTHING make any difference to you?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Not now. A long time ago, perhaps, when I was a little boy.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Tell me, where were you little?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: In Minnesota. On a farm.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Were you happy then, Cary?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I think so.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Tell me, what WAS there to be happy about on a farm in Minnesota?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (lost in thought) Ohhh, thorn-apple trees in blossom. The smell of burning leaves in the fall. The sound of horses' hoofs on the road. (looks at Nikki) Did you ever dig up an Indian mound or uncover a nest of baby field mice? Or explore old trunks in an attic? Listen to the moaning of the telephone wires in the winter wind? See a gypsy caravan?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (enthralled) So THAT'S why you were happy. On account of apple blossoms and field mice and telephone wires and gypsy caravans and old trunks and things?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: That's right.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: But aren't you going back? Not ever?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Would you like another picon citron before you go? The rain is lifting.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: No. I'm ready now.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: Cary and Nikki stroll into view, arm in arm, and look around. The rain has stopped. They are the only living people in the ancient cemetery.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: They've paused. Cary looks around, points with his cane.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He gives her a look and they move on.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: They stop.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: They approach the large tomb which is fenced off by a low iron gate. Cary removes his hat, Nikki peers at the double sepulchre through her lorgnette.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: They crouch at the iron bars of the gate surrounding the tomb and take off their gloves under the following:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: They reach through the gate to poke at the rocks and gravel surrounding the tomb. After a moment, Nikki rises and walks off excitedly with a stone in her hand.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Cary, too, finds a stone and rises to join her.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Who all is buried here?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Oh, poets, painters, philosophers--
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Cocoanut?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: No cocoanut. Poets, painters, philosophers, musicians.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: There's Chopin.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Oh, I practiced him.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: And there's Balzac. And there's Heloise and Abelard.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Oh, tell me about Abelise and Eloard.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: No, Nikki. Not Abelise and Eloard. Heloise and Abelard.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I'm sorry. I really didn't do it on purpose. It was on account of the picon citron. Tell me about Heloise and Abelard.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Well, they're buried here in the same sepulchre side by side.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Why are they buried side by side?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: They were the world's most famous lovers. (looks off, points with his cane) There's the tomb.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Tell me about the world's most famous lovers.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Well, Abelard was a scholastic philosopher--
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Whatever that is.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Whatever that is. He gained a footing in a certain household as tutor to a maiden called Heloise. And employed his unlimited opportunities for the purpose of-- Well, betrayal. Not, however, unmixed with real love. He carried her off to Brittany.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Tell me more.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Well, her uncle was furious. He blamed Abelard for the whole thing. He conceived a terrible revenge.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (uneasy) I'm afraid for Abelard.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: He broke into Abelard's apartment one night and perpetrated upon him the most brutal punishment.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Oh, dear.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: The lovers were forced to live their lives apart. But when they died, they were buried here side by side. (peers down at the ground) There's a story that little heart- shaped stones are supposed to grow around the tomb.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Heart-shaped stones?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: And lovers come and find them and exchange them with each other. (looks at Nikki) And, so long as you keep the stone from the tomb of Heloise and Abelard, no harm can come to your true love.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: How perfectly beautiful.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Isn't that a quaint legend?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Do you think I might find a heart- shaped stone? You help me, Cary.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: All right, Nikki. Only we have to leave soon. (looks off) They close up the place.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Just as soon as we find our stones.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I found one! Where's yours?
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: as the couple sits near the tomb. They show each other the stones in their upturned hands. Nikki takes the heart-shaped stone from her palm and places it in Cary's stiff, weathered hand. Then she transfers his stone to her hand.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: They close their hands over the stones as we PULL BACK to a WIDER VIEW of Nikki and Cary smiling at one another.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He starts to rise but she puts a hand on his arm.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He stares at her, astonished, as she rambles on.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Nikki turns to put the bracelet in her purse. Thoroughly unnerved by this emotional outburst, Cary looks around.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Cary rises, deeply uncomfortable. Nikki tries to make amends.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Cary turns and looks at her, amazed.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He looks down at the heart-shaped stone held awkwardly in his stiff hand. His thumb brushes the stone and it falls to the ground.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: And, now, you take mine. And I'll take yours.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Isn't that the way the story goes?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: That's right, Nikki.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: And, now, no harm can come to our true love.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (amused) And, now, we'll have to go.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: You were so nice to let me come with you. I spoiled your whole day. You were going to do something else, weren't you?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (looks away) Doesn't matter.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Well, what was it, Cary? Why did you come here today?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (not looking at her) To pay my respects to an old comrade.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Oh. And you wanted to be alone. I'm sorry. Oh, I'm so sorry. (begins to weep softly) Don't pay any attention to me, Cary. I can't help it. You MAKE me cry.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Oh, don't look so troubled, Cary. I'm all right. I just want to cry for a minute. (puts a hand on his shoulder) On account of you're so nice. You're so clean, Cary. And your teeth are so white. You're so civilized. You don't care about anything any more, nor anybody. Nothing makes any difference to you. Nothing can touch you. (realizes) Why, you're lost. You're ALL lost. You and Shep and the rest of you. (takes his hand) Oh, I want to do something for you. I want to help you. (looks at his wrist) Let me wash your bracelet, Cary. (points) Why, see? The silver's all tarnished. The silver's all tarnished. (removes his bracelet) I'll take it with me and scrub it when I get home. I'll polish it with my nail-brush.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: It's getting dark.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Well ... (rises, cheerily) Anyway, we found a name for my turtles!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Heloise and Abelard? A name for your turtles? So that's what you were looking for. I might have known how it would end.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: Nikki sits, soberly polishing Cary's bracelet with her nail brush. Shep enters, drink in hand.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: She looks at Shep forlornly.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Shep walks over and confronts her.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Shep cracks up with laughter and falls backward on the bed, his head dangling over the edge.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Shep keeps laughing, twists around on the bed and sits up again.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Shep holds a hand to his head and catches his breath as Nikki joins him on the bed.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Shep cracks up again. Worried, Nikki tugs at his sleeve.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Nikki rises and urgently pulls Shep, helpless with laughter, to his feet.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: She pushes him toward the door.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: They exit.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Hi, Nik.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (sadly) Hello.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Cary's in a state. Says he's going away. Can't stand it any longer and all that sort of thing. (sits on the bed) What happened between you two, anyway?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Cary seemed so sad and everything -- on account of I'd taken up his whole afternoon. (sighs) So little Nikki said, all merry and bright, "Well, anyway, we'd found a name for my turtles."
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: A name for the turtles?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: That's funny!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Name for the turtles! That's so funny, all right!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Why do you always HAVE to be funny at the wrong time? Didn't I tell you Cary was brittle? How did he respond to THAT line?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (morosely) Pulled down the iron curtain.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Did he say he was going away?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (through his laughter) Yup. Gotta get away from it all.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Then, you've got to go to him right now!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: And explain that I didn't mean it! Tell him how it was and everything!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Listen--
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: No, go on. You go right now before it's too late!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: But Nikki--!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: You go right straight to Cary.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: Cary removes clothes from a rack as a now serious Shep, drink in hand, stands nearby trying to reason with him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Cary packs a weathered suitcase.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Cary stops packing and gives Shep a look.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Shep stares at Cary, astonished, and moves off. Cary sets his packed suitcase upright.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Now, listen, Cary, you don't have to behave like an old Easter egg. You're breaking Nikki's heart. She doesn't know any better.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: She doesn't know any better? Well, whether she does or not, I'm going a long ways away from Nikki. Nikki and her turtles. SHEP Whew! You sure are in an uproar. What YOU need is a drink!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I need more than a drink. I need a lot of geography between me and that girl.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Where do you want to go?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Anywheres. So long as it's a long way from Nikki. (pauses, looks at Shep) You know -- that girl does things to me. (back to packing) I've got to get away.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Well, I wonder what's happening in Portugal tonight.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Say ... (thinks it over) I wonder what IS happening in Portugal tonight.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: Bill and Shep set a large steamer trunk upright.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Bill opens the trunk.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Nikki appears, carrying a suitcase.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Getting organized for their own impromptu Portuguese expedition, Bill, Francis and Shep fill the trunk with Nikki's things as Frink leans on it, smoking a cigarette and eyeing Nikki coolly.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Bill joins Nikki.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: She brushes past him and crosses to a table where she is joined by Frink.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Frink walks out the door. Nikki sighs a little and then busies herself with carrying items the trunk. Shep arrives with a selection of dresses as the group crowds together. Chaotic overlapping dialogue:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: From the trunk, we
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Heave ho!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Ah! There you go.
dialogue.name: dialogue
