dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Sure we got rights!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Cary better not think he can screw up in Portugal and leave old Shep behind.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Say, when's he leaving?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Ten-thirty in the morning. Sud Express.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Don't we have to have passports and things?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Sure we gotta have passports!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: What kind passports you like?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: What kind passports you got?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: We have ebony, cocoanut, thornberry passports.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (grandly) I'll take vanilla.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Good night, Nikki. I'll see you on the train.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: You're goin', too?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Why not? (with a sly smile) I might, uh, pick up a couple of features for my paper - in Portugal.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Nikki, do you want --?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Did you put all my shoes in?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: You bet. There they are--
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I don't know how you're going to get all these dresses in, Nikki.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: A mountain of trunks and other luggage piled on the floor. Nikki sits down near Shep who finishes packing a suitcase on the floor.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Francis leans casually on the towering pile of luggage. Bill stands next to him, smoking a cigarette and calling ironically to Nikki:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Francis clicks his tongue as he regards the pile.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Suddenly, Nikki gasps and rises.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Don't we have to go like anything? The train leaves in twenty minutes.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Are you SURE you have everything?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (misses the irony) I - I think so.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (dryly) Hardly seems enough.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Oh, my turtles! My turtles!
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: are plucked from the tub and placed in ... ... A BASKET by Nikki's little Asian maid. The fancy beribboned wicker basket has an oversized handle which makes it a rather improbable turtle carrier. Bill secures a wire mesh covering over the basket and carries it out of the bathroom, handing it grandly to Francis. BILL Here you are, Francis! You're the custodian of the turtles! Now don't fall down on the job. Bill walks off. Francis calls after him, worried:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Nikki arrives with a bottle of water and soaks her hand.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: She gives Francis the bottle and sprinkles the turtles with water from her wet hand. NIKKI - is to sprinkle 'em now and then, like this.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Some of the water ends up in Francis' eye which he wipes with the basket's ribbon. Nikki walks off and Francis practices soaking his hand and sprinkling the turtles.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Hey! I never tended turtles before.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Now, all you have to do -
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Oh, yeah. I see.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: Five bellhops march in and, under the direction of Nikki and the men, proceed to carry off the luggage, chattering in French.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Burdened with luggage, the bellhops file out through the suite. Bill, suitcase in hand, follows them out, beckoning to Francis behind him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Francis hurries along carrying the basket, followed by Shep and Nikki.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . TRAIN STATION - LATER THAT MORNING A whistle BLOWS. Their luggage already aboard, Francis, Nikki, Shep and Bill walk down the platform, parallel to the train. Bill claps his hands exuberantly.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Bill laughs. Nikki peers at the train through her lorgnette.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Bill gives Francis a supportive pat on the back.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Francis nods soberly. Bill laughs. Nikki points, excited.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Well, we're off. (to a bellhop, about the trunk) Be careful of that one.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Uh, come on, Francis! Take those turtles!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: There she is, boys! The Sud Express!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Can you imagine Cary tryin' to run away and leave us behind?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Do you suppose he's really gonna be here?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Sure he'll be here. He's never missed a train in his life.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Say, do you suppose the turtles'll be all right with that porter?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Aw, sure they'll be all right. All you got to do is - (gestures with his hand) - sprinkle 'em!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: There he is!
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: Cary buys a paper from a newsboy and steps onto his train.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: On the train steps, Cary stops and turns as his friends arrive and gather around him, grinning.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Climbing the steps, Bill and Shep crowd a confused Cary and force him into the train. Following the others, Francis helps Nikki up the steps.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: They all board the train and head for:
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: (o.s.) Say, Cary!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Hello, Cary.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (surprised) Well, hello. What are you all doing down here?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: We just came down to see you off is all.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Well, that's darn decent of you.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Ya got a nice seat?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Yeah, right by a window.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Oh, how nice for you!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (with childlike desire) Come on! Show us your seat by the window!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (cheerful, insistent) Yeah, come on, Cary! We wanna SEE that seat by the window.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Come on, Nikki.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: The group crowds into the small compartment.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Bill pushes a button for the porter.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Everyone but Cary grabs a seat. Astonished, Cary stares at each as they speak: BILL Get off?! Gosh, no. We LIKE this train!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The whistle BLOWS. Cary panics.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The trains starts. Bill jauntily throws his hat up to the luggage rack above and the others settle in for their journey.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Frink enters casually.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Cary is stunned. Frink sits down with the others.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The group takes in the train's departure with perfect composure. Cary stands and looks at them for a moment before breaking into a understanding grin.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Cary sits. As the train hurtles out of the now empty station, Nikki suddenly turns to the window and waves goodbye to no one at all:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Shep, Bill and Francis quickly join in, waving and shouting goodbye, much to Cary's amusement. Even Frink manages a smile at this.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: My, my, what a swell train.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Sud Express, Train de Luxe. Say, I wonder if a chap can get a drink on this train.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Sure! I don't see why not. Push the button.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (flustered) Well, I'm afraid you won't have time for a drink. We're gonna start in a minute. You'll have to get off.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: This is a Train de Luxe.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Yes, we like trains de luxe, don't we, Nikki?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Sure! Trains de luxe is what we like.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Hey! He's blowing the whistle. (grabs Shep's shoulder) Hey, we're gonna start.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Well, let her start.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Let 'er go Gallagher. Who cares?!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Who cares?!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Who cares?!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Who cares?!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Hello, everybody.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: And you, too?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: That's right.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: That's right. Who cares?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Goodbye! Goodbye! Don't forget to write!
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: racing down the track.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The compartment doorway. We hear the men laughing. Bill -- drink in hand, his necktie loosened and his coat off -- appears in the doorway, coming from the train's corridor.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: With a grand gesture, Bill presents an elderly British gentleman who follows him into the little room, greeted with a cheer of "Hooray!" from the men who sit around, similarly coatless (save Frink), smoking and drinking. Various bottles stand on a central table. The old gentleman is greeted warmly but it's never clear whether he is an old friend or a total stranger.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Bill and the old gentleman sit down. Nikki dozes in her seat by the window. The basket of turtles hangs from above.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The men laugh. A whistle BLOWS. The conductor appears briefly in the doorway to announce in French that the mademoiselle's compartment is ready.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Nikki wakes, rises, and clutching her pillow, heads for the doorway.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Bill rises to confer with her at the door.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The old gentleman looks rather astonished at this casual exchange.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The men say, "Good night." Frink, who has been watching Nikki with a predatory eye, is the most polite:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Nikki turns and disappears down the corridor. The old gentleman mops his brow with a handkerchief and stuffs it in his collar.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: During the next exchange, Frink, seated by the door, grins at Bill and Shep, then notices Francis dozing off. Frink cautiously rises and exits into the corridor without anyone noticing his departure.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Francis' pocket watch CHIMES. He wakes, rises, puts on his hat and moves absently toward the door. Seeing this, Shep, Bill and Cary shout at him: "Whoa!" Francis pauses in the doorway and sleepily turns to the others.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Francis moves to the hanging basket of turtles, takes off his hat and, bottle in hand, wets his fingers and sprinkles the turtles. Curious, the old gentleman rises to join him. Francis explains as he works:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The old gentleman nods and clicks his tongue with understanding.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: A woman's SCREAM drifts in from the corridor.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The men hear Nikki SCREAMING. CARY Nikki! Francis, Cary, Bill and Shep -- in that order -- scramble out the door, leaving the old gentleman behind.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The men rush down the corridor to:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Cary rolls his eyes at this remark and wisely holds Bill back.

direction.raw_text: Frink turns to her in protest.

direction.raw_text: Cocktail shaker in the hands of an expert who shakes it rhythmically as appropriate Latin MUSIC begins. Everyone drinks, except Frink who smokes a cigarette and stares, desirous and snakelike, presumably at Nikki. DISSOLVE TO Nikki and her war birds (minus Frink) seated at a bar in an otherwise empty club late at night, wearing goofy party hats. They swallow a last drink and start to leave -- laughing, talking, merrily blowing little party horns, taking a bottle or two with them, and waving to an unseen bartender as they go. Someone says, "Good night." We TRACK IN for a closer look at the bar, covered with many empty glasses. And the music and the montage end.

Four toreros rush in. They surround and distract the bull. Bill lies motionless. Cary runs across the ring. More toreros and others rush in, surrounding the bull, finally leading away. dialogue.raw_text: Put down that gun!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Listen, you keep your hands off me! I've had enough from you! You try any more of your rough stuff on me--!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Oh, so that's how it is. I thought we taught you how to behave.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: You taught ME how to behave?! Listen, you'd better behave now or you'll get hurt!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (calmly) I don't think so. I'll give you three to put down that gun. It'll be just too bad if you don't.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Too bad for who?!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: One ...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Keep away from me! I'll shoot, I tell ya! I'll shoot!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Two ...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I'll shoot! I'll shoot!
dialogue.name: dialogue
